question.text: In an NPN transistor circuit, the collector current is <math> <mrow> <mn>10</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext> </mtext><mtext>mA</mtext><mtext>.</mtext></mrow> </math> If <math> <mrow> <mn>90</mn><mi>%</mi></mrow> </math> of the emitted electrons reach the collector, the emitter current <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></msub></mfenced></math> and base current <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfenced separators="|"><msub><mi>I</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></msub></mfenced></math> are given by

options.text: <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>11</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

<math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">E</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>11</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mo>,</mo><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">I</mi></mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>

solution.text:
We know that

IC=90100×IE⇒10=0.9×IE

∴IE=100.9=11 mA

Also IE=IB+IC⇒IB=11-10=1 mA .
